alert.note: Alert for Coshocton; Muskingum (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 9:26PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A CLUSTER OF STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN COSHOCTON AND NORTHWESTERN MUSKINGUM COUNTIES THROUGH 1000 PM EDT... At 924 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms near Frazeysburg, or 12 miles northeast of Newark, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Zanesville, North Zanesville, Dresden, Frazeysburg, Warsaw, Pleasant Grove, Nellie, Drake, New Guilford, Cooperdale, and Dillon State Park. This includes Interstate 70 in Ohio between mile markers 156 and 159. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
